roleset.name: shield from danger
roleset.note: PROTECT-V NOTES: Member of Vncls defend-85. (from protect.01-v)
PROTECTION-N NOTES: Roleset based on protect.01. No corresponding verbnet class. Framed by Katie. (from protection.01-n)

roles.note: The protector/instrument distinction largely comes down tointentionality. Instrumental subjects seem to be much more common. (from protect.01-v)

example.name: protect-v: agentive subject and instrument
example.text: Republicans-1 want *trace*-1 to protect the measure by combining it with two politically popular issues that Democrats would find hard to vote against.
example.arg: by combining it with two politically popular issues that Democrats would find hard to vote against.

example.name: protect-v: instrumental subject
example.text: Mr. Wilder introduced a bill [0]-2 *trace-2* to protect rape victims from unfounded interrogation.

example.name: protect-v: passivized
example.text: [The information]-1 is protected *trace*-1 by attorney-client priviledge.

example.name: protection-n: Example with arg 2
example.text: such proceedings give it protection from creditor lawsuits

example.name: protection-n: One more arg 1 and 2 as this is the most common
example.text: Their only protection against a brutal winter

example.name: protection-n: with arg3
example.text: Everything you've ever wanted to know about the use of personal protection with firearms in the home

roleset.name: acting defensively for the safety/preservation of something dear
roleset.note: PROTECTIVE-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from protective.01-j)

example.name: protective-j
example.text: Scott is protective of his private life:
